website_summaries.verdict: It's a fun copter for beginners, but advanced users will want a more robust product with better battery life and performance.
pros: Ideal for low-light flying thanks to LED light indicators on the front and back
cons: Very short flight time, even on fully charged batteries

customer_reviews.title: Great little quadcopter.
customer_reviews.text: As an amateur R/C hobbiest, I've owned several different helicopter models and some nitro cars/trucks. This little Estes quad flies very well, just as well as my micro-helicopter costing hundreds. My 6 year old could master it within a day or so (I recommend the protective kit that is available if you plan on giving this to a younger person). My only complaint would be the trim needs finer adjustment, but with the capability of getting 99% dialed-in, this is not worth removing a star. Flight time was about 5-8 min doing some flips. The blinking lights which indicate a low battery allow you to make a safe landing.
customer_reviews.author: M. Marceau

customer_reviews.title: So Much Fun!
customer_reviews.text: I have bought many inexpensive mini-copters (main rotor/tail rotor) over the years, and though they are fun, they are uniformly frustrating to fly. They are near impossible to hover without many hours of practice, and you generally destroy them before you can master the controls. Not so the quad-copter! It was easy to make this one hover and because it maintains its own attitude I can fly it relative to my own point of view rather than the aircraft's. I have no interest in doing flips or tricks: just controlled flight, and this one does that better than any I've seen. And for this price, when I break it I'll buy another one!
customer_reviews.author: I_Will

customer_reviews.title: ok product, has its issues
customer_reviews.text: Its a cute little buzzing quadcopter, however, its not for beginners it has some issues with trimming and really short fly time, a beginner will not like this because of the unreal expectations about battery life, the other issue it has some trimming issues, mine kept drifting to the right side and trimming it little would change the drift to the left it was not bad though I had fun, I just wish if they had easy access to the battery since the flight time is very short would liked to have more than one battery charged for extended time, but for $28 I think its good as any
customer_reviews.author: Salrous

customer_reviews.title: LOTS of FUN & a decent little flyer.
customer_reviews.text: This little quadcopter is a riot! It took a little time (10 flights+-) as a first time flyer to get the hang of it but it's easy to recharge and allot of fun. After a few weeks I'm starting to have some issues with one of the motors not wanting to start but after I tinker with the prop it gets going. I have had a couple of hard crashes within my house and so far its shaken it off for the most part. Occasionally I have to adjust the props or the trim in order to keep it flying properly but for the $ and considering it was a toy I really like the eye hand coordination it requires.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely love this thing.
customer_reviews.text: I give VERY FEW five star reviews. I can't think of anything I would change about this little thing. It's great. Very durable flying indoors. When you hit something the props just fling off without damaging anything. If you've tried your share of indoor quadcopters as I have, you'll totally dig this thing. It comes with a bunch of spare props too and I love the fact that it has a USB charger. Just don't lose it. Haven't flown it much outside but when I did it worked pretty well as long as there's not too much wind. The lights on this thing are great and really help with keeping track of it's orientation in flight.
customer_reviews.author: J. Pace

customer_reviews.title: Fun but challenging to fly without mishaps
customer_reviews.text: These are great fun to fly but challenging if you don't have any experience. I went through a set of props to get reasonably decent at keeping it in the air. Unfortunately, one motor quit working after a couple of months of flying a few times a week. I really like having the LED lights for direction... blue in the front and red in the back tells me in which direction it is oriented I moved up to the Blade Nano (costs about twice as much as the Proto X) and it's much easier to fly in the Stability mode. Wish it had LED lights as well. It also has prop guards... haven't damaged a prop yet.
customer_reviews.author: Don Kxxxxx

customer_reviews.title: This little nano quad is a boat load of fun and totally worth the very inexpensive price
customer_reviews.text: This little nano quad is a boat load of fun and totally worth the very inexpensive price. It is a bit harder to fly than some of the bigger nano or mini quads. I'd say it is a bit on the unstable side and it certainly crashes a lot and the little props are pretty hard to find when they go flying off after a crash. I would not recommend as your first quad but if you are familiar with quads and OK with a challenge it's a must have. BTW, you can fly this quad with the same radio that comes with the Hubsan X4 which permits you to do flips and such.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Williams

customer_reviews.title: Fun but not long lasting
customer_reviews.text: Very fun to fly however the motors don't last long. I always seem to have one motor that doesn't want to work properly after a while and the only way it functions on take off is by severe trimming but at full power the motor kicks in and the trimming is off again. I'm returning my second one today. I'll give another one more a try, but if another burns out within 2-3 weeks (maybe 1 or 2 flights a day) I'm returning and not requesting a replacement. A shame because I really do like it. Would I recommend these to a friend? Yup.. still very fun to fly.. arggghhh but the motors!!!!
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: super fun, but not very easy to fly.
customer_reviews.text: These things are a bit tough to fly unless you get the trim set just right, or unless you're an expert quadcopter pilot. They're super cool and fun to fly though. I wouldn't buy this and expect to have a fleet of them flying through obstacle courses in your office. I have a DJI Phantom that I can fly like a boss, but these are considerably tougher to operate. Also, you have to put the propellers on exactly right or it will not achieve lift. I have crashed mine probably a hundred times and it will still fly. I would go ahead and buy a bunch of extra propellers though or you'll run out pretty quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Great toy!
customer_reviews.text: This little guy is amazing!!! If you want a fun cheap toy, this is it. - Pretty easy to figure out the set-up - Learning to fly wasn't easy at all. I would hover it off the ground and fly around until I got the hang of it. After about 4 hours of flying, it sort of worked. Never become a pro like people in the Youtube Videos. - Controller isn't great, one side felt different then the other Good Luck and have fun!
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Durability?
customer_reviews.text: If this worked for more than 4 days this quad would have a full 5 stars. Since the quality is such that it still flys, but fails to maintain any lift or control, I have to give it one star. I would love to get it replaced, but from the other comments it doesn't look too easy. So, it was fun while it lasted. I was not rough with the little bug at all; but seeing that it's a "beginner" quad, I would have expected it to last at least a week before going bad. BTW mine was white. Didn't mind that but just throwing it out there.
customer_reviews.author: M. Buresh

customer_reviews.title: Fun to Learn and Fun to Fly
customer_reviews.text: I love this quadcopter. This is a great quad to practice flying indoors and just for messing around. The battery lasts 3-5min and only takes 20min to charge which means several hours of flying fun. It was really rewarding seeing how quickly my flying skills progressed with every flight. As much as I like this quad I can't rate it five stars as my motors burnt out after the 20th or so flight (a week of usage) . That being said I am a new flier and had slammed it into the wall quite a few times...I also had to re-solder one of the motor wires that snapped off after a crash which could have shortened their lifespan.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to control
customer_reviews.text: I spent most of my time just trying to trim this thing out. I think my longest flight was eight seconds. On the plus side, it is tough...I banged it around quite a bit and it kept coming back for more. Well built. But, the little tiny controller is a plain nuisance. Forget it. Get the X4 controller. Once I received that, I actually began to have success flying the Estes copter. But, it is still impossible to trim out and fly accurately. It's a true wanderer...if you can fly this thing, there is no quad in the world you can not fly.
customer_reviews.author: Mike3746

customer_reviews.title: A really good quad, great for beginners!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is awesome!!! It is a wonderful little quadcopter. I definitely recommend this to any beginners. This is the quad that I started out with. The propellers or blades do fall off easily, I rather them fall of then break. What I sugest if this is a problem is to put a drop of paint on both sides of the blade, choose a color that is easy to see and stands out, then when it crashes you ca very easily find the blades. Other than that it is an amazing little quadcopter. Ps. Have had no problems with motor. 😜
customer_reviews.author: John McD

customer_reviews.title: Nice toy but very squirrelly
customer_reviews.text: I don't know if I received a defective one but I cannot get it to hover stationary at all. I have adjusted the trim settings but to no avail. That being said I still enjoy it so long as I have a big enough room to use it in. If you are new to rc flyers I would recommend the Syma 107 over this. It is half the price and very robust. It's a great toy but if you buy it like I did, on a whim, don't go balls to the wall, you will damage it. Ive had mine for a couple months and it still flies, even using the initial blades.
customer_reviews.author: nmrtnz

customer_reviews.title: Can survive war
customer_reviews.text: This littel bugger is tough! It made an ocean landing and was submerged for 40 minutes until rescued. Dissasembled and allowed dry 4 days. even with rust on one motor, the machine came back to life and was able to fly with no issues. )bypassed battery IC and rejuiced with 9V source momentaritly, then the charge circuit started working again. WIsh the controls had more fidelity, they required precise fingers and it does not help when the power to weight ratio on this thing is so ridicolous .
customer_reviews.author: Mauricio

customer_reviews.title: Super fun but not crash-worthy
customer_reviews.text: This is a fun little toy for 35 bucks. I can't believe how well it flies at this price point. It takes some practice to learn how to fly it, but that is part of the fun. The only draw-back is that the 4 blades are unprotected, so when you get too close to a wall (and you WILL), it crashes, a blade or 2 fly off, and you quickly run through your 4 replacement blades (they are impossible to find in shag carpet). Do yourself a favor, and go find a protective ring to put on it before you fly... I found one for less than 10 bucks. I would recommend this to anyone who is curious about quadcopters!
customer_reviews.author: M. De Jong

customer_reviews.title: Fun quad, needs better instructions, spare parts would be good as well.
customer_reviews.text: Fun little quad. Lack of interchangeable batteries is a problem, they are highly hackable with Hubsan Q4 parts. That said, the instructions did not have the calibration instructions. Must Hubsan remotes will pair with this helo, and you can make it do flips and such with an X4 remote as well. The downside, after a few days of flying it, my forward left motor quit. It's not an easy replacement and requires a soldering gun. Haven't flown it since.
customer_reviews.author: P. Clark

customer_reviews.title: impossible to control
customer_reviews.text: I charged the unit and followed the "pairing" instructions. The unit paired as expected but you could not achieve a stable flight. I tried to adjust both trim adjustments but was never able to achieve a stable hover. The unit would vier off to the side and flip over. Went through all of the "trouble shooting " directions but was not able to correct the problem Finally, elected to return it and get a latger quadcopter.. Thanks to Amazon for their excellent return policy.
customer_reviews.author: richard s earle

customer_reviews.title: Worked as expected
customer_reviews.text: Bought it, flew it, it was a lot of fun and pretty robust as I learned to fly it. It acts like an air hockey puck once you set it going sideways. Tested it on a street to a range of about 100 feet. Very quick lift off the ground and handy light scheme with LEDs to tell orientation (going away or coming toward the operator). Ultra lightweight, the printed circuit board acts as the aircraft frame. Spare props provided, but not needed yet despite the collisions it has had with other objects.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Lockwright

customer_reviews.title: Very fun toy!
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for a unique gift to give to someone, the Nano R/C Quadcopter if the perfect gift. It's really easy to fly, land with the remote controls and so fun to play with around the house. We have given this gift to many of our adult friends and they have loved it. The Qaudcopter is very light weight therefore use caution if you use it outdoors. My husband tried flying it outside on a day that was too windy and the Qaudcopter got swept away in the wind never to be found again.
customer_reviews.author: V. Smith

customer_reviews.title: As much fun as you can have indoors.
customer_reviews.text: WoW! What fun this thing is. I bought it to practice hovering indoors in the winter months, and am having a blast! Very stable, yet agile and tough. If you break it , you will probably need to buy a new one as the frame is the circuit board, but I have slammed it into a few walls, and bounced it off the floor several times and so far, so good. It still flies perfectly and after around 100 flights, I'm getting braver all the time, LOOK OUT HONEY, HERE I COME!
customer_reviews.author: Jim Langley

customer_reviews.title: Great!!
customer_reviews.text: This was the first quad that I ever purchased. What a joy! Having never flown anything like this before, I managed to crash it into about everything in the house learning to fly. I have replaced countless blades, several motors and motor holders, and a couple of batteries. It is still going strong but is showing quite a bit of wear and tear. I will be replacing it but only because of appearance, not because of any performance issues.
customer_reviews.author: guyinvegas

customer_reviews.title: More durable and fun than it looks
customer_reviews.text: It looks really fragile, but it is both smaller and stronger than the photographs here portray (to me at least). I expected it to break really fast, but so far cats have attacked it, it's flown into walls, dropped from the top of a loft's ceiling, and had a series of nerf darts strike it mid-flight. I suspect the biggest breaking point is overcharging/undercharging, so be sure to read the instructions on charging (it's a LiPo). This thing is AWESOME.
customer_reviews.author: paws

customer_reviews.title: Fun! Great!
customer_reviews.text: This is awesome! I have bought 3 of these. One for me and two others as gifts. My one complaint is the propellers fall off if you hit something even when I had a 3D printed guard on it. I fixed mine by a small dab of super glue on the tip of the output shafts. I have been flying mine for at least 7 months now and it finally died after I hit a rafter in a gymnasium and it fell 30 some feet and broke. I'm not upset by that at all. I would definitely recommend this and I will probably be purchasing another.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Sidoti

customer_reviews.title: Fun but just a cheap toy
customer_reviews.text: I got this today and everyone talks about flying it inside the house. I would say this is quite difficult to do and I don't have a small room. Once the snow melts I will try it outside and see how that goes. I don't expect much of this thing, but a bit of fun. A great addition would be if you could tell it to just hover at whatever height so you can just fly around and not worry about going up and down. I can't get it to stay at one height... it is almost always going up or not and is quite sensitive.
customer_reviews.author: Froggy

customer_reviews.title: This copter is fun and easy to fly even if you never thrown ...
customer_reviews.text: This copter is fun and easy to fly even if you never thrown anything before. Because of it's nano size, a few crashes at the beginning is no problem. It also come with extra two sets of blades. Make sure you match the "A" or "B" blades with the corresponding motor marking otherwise it won't fly. The first one I got wouldn't take off. Contacted Amazon for a refund and overnight replacement free of charge. That rocks.
customer_reviews.author: dk4808

customer_reviews.title: WOW! best flying toy I've ever had and sooo tiny!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for a few days now and am completely blown away with how well this flies. I've flown RC planes for years and have tried a few helicopters and quad copters before with marginal success. This little thing is so stable and easy to fly! it is 4 channel, so if you aren't used to using both sticks in all directions you may struggle a little. I am able to fly this around my house easily which I have never been able to do before. I love this thing. hope it holds up well.
customer_reviews.author: Riley

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome little toy. Takes a little getting used to in order to fly it well, but it is very stable right out of the box. I have gone through two of these, smashing them up pretty good and they still kept flying. I finally did them in eventually, after NUMEROUS hard crashes. The props pop off easily which probably saved the little guy several times. They go right back on with no trouble. These come with an extra set of props. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Dirty Jack

customer_reviews.title: Fun little quad!
customer_reviews.text: I picked this up as a little trainer (ahead of getting the phantom vision) so my first experience flying a quad wasn't with an expensive one. This one was squirrelly, and a challenge to fly, but was great fun and instilled all of the right instincts. The stock control is a challenge, but very rewarding when you get it. I probably got 30 flights out of it...before one of the motors died. I estimate that to be about 25 flights more than I've gotten out of the typical $30 helicopters
customer_reviews.author: Charles Newcomb

customer_reviews.title: Very small - not for n00bs
customer_reviews.text: It's small. like seriously really really small. it was $40 when i bought it and i kinda wish i had my $40 back. it's been a year since i bought it and i think I've attempted to fly it maybe 15 times total. it's hard to understand how difficult it is to fly a small drone until you actually try it in person. if you're an experience drone buyer / flyer the story may be more successful, but if you're new to drones then buy a Hubsan.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Lots of fun and a good starter for new pilots.
customer_reviews.text: The most fun I've had with a flying RC toy yet. I will eventually get the hang of it and keep from flying into walls and other stationary items. This is the perfect start for learning how to fly and control a drone quad-copter. If you're looking for a starting point, I'd recommend this first. Start low to the ground, then work on elevation when you get better at controlling it. It's a lot of fun!
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Lots of fun, just takes practice!
customer_reviews.text: Great little toy, it takes a little while to get used to but patience, and you'll be flying in no time. The battery seems to last 8-10 minutes for me and charges off USB in under an hour. My word of advice for flying is to keep the blue LEDS facing forward that way you don't lose orientation, and go really easy on the controls at first. Practice leaning forward backward left right, then work on spinning left and right.
customer_reviews.author: M D

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: What a great RC toy! I have had this quadcopter for over the weekend and it is such a blast to fly! The design and look of the quadcopter is very nice and it feels solid. The LED lights on the copter are bright and vibrant. I have had some bad crashes into a wall or the window and this thing is still perfect! I would totally recommend this to my friends and anyone who has interest in the great world of RC hobby!
customer_reviews.author: MattRody

customer_reviews.title: A lot of Fun
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoy this little quad. It is about 2" square, so really small but just right for indoors. It has a high pitched whine that fits - I don't know how to explain this you have to hear it. It is very maneuverable and moves very fast and I would liken it to a dragon fly. The only drawback is that the props come off sometimes when you crash into things (yes, don't crash it), and then you have to look for them to put them back on. Still this quad is very cool to play with and I highly recommend it. You will like it.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Thompson

customer_reviews.title: lots of fun for low price
customer_reviews.text: These are so much fun. Surprisingly durable for such a small and frail looking device. And it's very reasonably priced. Not for very young children as it takes some skill to control it ... And it takes time to learn to control it. They should make the blades in brighter colors because they pop off easily when you crash it (they have to else it would break too easily) and they can be hard to find sometimes. Liked the first one so much that my wife also bought one. No troubles with either of them.
customer_reviews.author: R. Mueller

customer_reviews.title: Great Gift!!!!
customer_reviews.text: A friend of mine got me hooked on this Quadcpoter. I have flown then prior to this purchase. but i love they copter. its a great little gadget for kids as well as the Bigger Kids(adults that are kids at heart)LOL. But this toy make look cheap but its preaty durable i have hit and crahed this copter and all that really happend is the propelers popped out( they pop right back into place). Several of my co-worker including myself fly them on our lunch hour.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Freyland

customer_reviews.title: I've had loads of fun with this micro quad and have even given some ...
customer_reviews.text: Now that the market is saturated with alternatives, it can be tough to say that one is the 'best' of a quad. However, this was one of the first ones I owned and learned with and it was well worth it. I've had loads of fun with this micro quad and have even given some away as gifts to friends - to great reception. Overall, I highly recommend this as a fun indoors (or calm-day outdoors) quad to fly. Since this is just a re-branded Hubsan, you'll find that some of the larger quads from them carry the same level of quality and fun, as well as the radios being cross-compatible.
customer_reviews.author: Mike H

customer_reviews.title: Estes Quad. Received yesterday and flew right alway..  Wow
customer_reviews.text: I had reviewed videos on line before buying and was impressed to give it a try. I have a Traxus QR-1 and find it binds to Estes and makes for more stable flying. Shared with a friend and will be submitting orders for two more in a few minutes. One for his grand son and one for his self. He is recovering from hip surgery so we flew quad in living room while he was in recliner. Even impressed his wife. to point she wrote me a check to place order...
customer_reviews.author: David G. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Unfortunately this was pretty much useless device
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately this was pretty much useless device. Very disappointed! Nice about the seller is that he offered to replace the device and he did..but still the second one is also doesn't fly and my son almost lost interest in flying devices. Don't know why they even sell this. Two stars for the seller courtesy otherwise it's zero stars for the product. $30 wasted!
customer_reviews.author: Chipking

customer_reviews.title: Nice idea and could be an awesome toy, but not well built at all
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these as an office / home toy, but am returning it as its too flimsy / badly built and doesn't seem to work right. You have to keep trimming it to keep it straight and even then its difficult to control. As a result you'll need a large open area to avoid hitting things. Further, the motors aren't mounted securely which keeps nullifying any trim that you do.
customer_reviews.author: AK

customer_reviews.title: Solid, Powerful and Fun
customer_reviews.text: Great little Quadcopter! Remember a few years ago when the little helicopters were so popular? That's because the Estes Proto X wasn't around yet. The Estes Proto X is a deceptively agile quad with ample power and great controls. Easy to fly it in the house without causing any damage to anything but can be flown outdoors without a problem. Windy days excluded!
customer_reviews.author: King of Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Lots of fun!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is so cool!! I got it as a gift for my son for Christmas and he loves it! It takes a little practice to keep from crashing it at first but once you get the hang of it it's loads of fun. My only complaint is that the battery runs down very quickly and has to be recharged to continue playing with it-it probably lasts 10 minutes tops on one charge.
customer_reviews.author: Duzduz

customer_reviews.title: Coolest toy!
customer_reviews.text: This is the tiniest I have ever encountered. Great design as the circuit board itself is a the frame for the quad copter. Very clever. Flies fantastic. Used for over a month now. Still flies good. Flashing LEDs indicate when to land, another good feature. 4-5 minutes fly time. Charges in about 25 minutes. Amaze your friends and co workers. Too risky to fly outdoors as it can be lost in few seconds because of it's size.
customer_reviews.author: Ravindranath Papineni

customer_reviews.title: Love these little things
customer_reviews.text: Love these little things. They sound like angry mosquitoes. They are harder to fly than the larger ones, but once you get used to them, they are fun. It comes with an extra set of blades, but if I were you, I would order at least two extra sets. Oh. And a little advice... Don't fly them into your children. It may be funny to you, but apparently these little mosquitoes pack quite the bite!
customer_reviews.author: Dustin McConnell

customer_reviews.title: Yeah
customer_reviews.text: can't ask for much more from a 20 dollar drone, its fallen from very high heights, fallen in the toilet (don't ask how), and sustained a dogs munching. the plane is not stable and not very easy to maintain in one spot, yes i am an experiences flyer and i know how these things work. It is what you can get for 20 dollars. fun office toy for the moments of just doing nothing.
customer_reviews.author: claudia briolini

customer_reviews.title: Works great with 2 batteries at once!! (Link below)
customer_reviews.text: Best money I spent on a quad copter. Flies very Well. Allows hot swappable batteries ( if you take of cage) and the advanced controller with flips work if you buy the STL controller. Here I hacked mine to run with 2 batteries to fly longer. [...]
customer_reviews.author: Rody Davis

customer_reviews.title: Really fun, durable little guy.
customer_reviews.text: Good price for a really well-made quadcopter. I have had some problems here and there, but after a google search or two, it flies like a dream. So much fun. The only complaint I have is that the propellers seem to come off easily. They're so small that they're easy to lose. Does come with a full set of spare props. Replacement props are a little hard to find at the moment - every place says they're on back order. Anyway, I could say a few other nit-picky complaints, but this is still a 5-start review. Love this little guy.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Berthiaume

customer_reviews.title: Lots of fun but the motors don't last very long...
customer_reviews.text: It was lots of fun and flew well. It will take lots of bumps and as long as you cut the power when you hit something there is normally no damage. The only frustrating part was - in my experience it was only good for about 20 (5 minute) flights before one of the motors began to fail. I suspect the brushes were already worn out. Its fun but just for a short period of time...
customer_reviews.author: Scott H.

customer_reviews.title: Flies great, but be warned
customer_reviews.text: Flies great, but be warned, this lil thing can get moving surprisingly fast! Would recommend trying to fly in some larger rooms for the first flight. Low battery lights go off with enough time left to get it back to a desired landing position which is nice. Some other models I've bought only give you a couple seconds after the lights start flashing before the battery is gone. The only complaint I have is that the propellers are VERY fragile. Had to replace three so far. And sometimes they don't come off very easily. Word of warning: don't pull too hard or you'll risk pulling the motor off with it!
customer_reviews.author: Aaron J  Labertew

customer_reviews.title: Ordered it to play with. We never could trim ...
customer_reviews.text: Ordered it to play with. We never could trim it out to hoover, and we only got it under control twice. After about 10 tries, one motor stopped working. They should test them before they box them up for sell. . The blades are sharp and spin very fast. It hit my grandson in the face and left three small cuts. Use caution when playing with it.
customer_reviews.author: Denny Romero

customer_reviews.title: its so fun
customer_reviews.text: Man if you have any birds or quads you got to buy this thing its so fast for its size and I still have not broken mine .I own a blade 450 3d anda qaud 350x and I play with this just as much. The blades on my copter cost more then this really cool quad just one note I WOULD NOT BUY FOR LITTLE KIDS ! I ffigure 12 and up and some flight experience a great idea but its way more bang then buck
customer_reviews.author: Harold

customer_reviews.title: Really cool
customer_reviews.text: This is way better than those rc helicopters that are more expensive and have less mobility, it was hard to learn how to control but a few days practice and i'm getting used to it. I would like for it to have its own ac adapter so i don't always have too use my computer or phone charger but thats no big deal. A prop guard would be nice although it handles crashes pretty well.
customer_reviews.author: Ryne Avery

customer_reviews.title: DANGEROUS (LY AWESOME!)
customer_reviews.text: I bought this thing a few years ago, and I have to admit it got me hooked. It was the perfect price and build quality for a started drone, and influenced me to buy more (and more expensive!) drones. Suuuuuuper easy to fly, and fun indoors!
customer_reviews.author: Andy G

customer_reviews.title: The greatest!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the greatest gift you can give! My boyfriend is really hard to buy for and he loves this Quadcopter! I have spent alot of money purchasing RC Copters, Planes and Trucks only to get the "Oh, this is great, thank you" only never to see it again. He takes this with him everywhere! I hope I get one for my birthday!
customer_reviews.author: LIZ T

customer_reviews.title: Not very reliable.
customer_reviews.text: After about 20 flights, one of the motor has stopped working. I don't really use this extensively ,I just bought it to get a feel. I haven't crashed it or anything major, but it seems that the motors stop working after some flights. Giving 3 stars because at its size, it flies pretty good and is stable. Another thing was it never stood in same place ever, no matter how much trim adjustments you do.
customer_reviews.author: Joshi

customer_reviews.title: Too sensitive, hard to fly (Even for a pro)
customer_reviews.text: Tiny and is very very oversensitive to controls. A tiny push of the stick sends it flying across the room at 15 miles per hour or so... not a fan. I've also heard it's very fragile, as the circuitboard is the body- so if it happened to shoot straight across the room into a brick wall, it might break. Not a fan, only for large spaces.
customer_reviews.author: Mobius

customer_reviews.title: This is REALLY fun, and gets very precise once you've had a ...
customer_reviews.text: This is REALLY fun, and gets very precise once you've had a few hours of practice. Note that the battery tends to unglue from the circuit board and move around in the little fairing, which causes the little copter to go wild. Durability is so so, I've had two and they both had a dead motor after a few months.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These things are just the best, they zip around effortlessly and are surprisingly nimble
customer_reviews.text: These things are just the best, they zip around effortlessly and are surprisingly nimble. Leaps and bounds above the Cheerson CX10. I have the controller from the Hubsan X4 which binds to this quad and with it the range is incredible!
customer_reviews.author: C. Ziegler

customer_reviews.title: Fun, but disappointed
customer_reviews.text: The unit is a fun toy to play with for about an hour, then it lost it's uniqueness. The propellers break or become damaged after a short period of usage. The motors require glue to keep from vibrating loose and causing irregular flight(s). It was fun to learn how to fly it, but it doesn't really do anything. It isn't strong enough to lift or carry any items.
customer_reviews.author: DTB_Texas

customer_reviews.title: headgear recommended
customer_reviews.text: Fun toy. Much trickier to operate than you would think (for those with no rc experience at all, like me). DO NOT accidentally fly it into your own head and get it caught in your hair. Twice. It is a nightmare to untangle from long hair, though I did manage to untangle it (twice) with more damage to my hair than the copter.
customer_reviews.author: f march

customer_reviews.title: Big bang for the buck.
customer_reviews.text: Love this little thing. Helps me practice during the winter so that I can own the skies with my big multirotor. My only complaint about this thing are the cheap plastic knobs on the bottom of the motors. If you land hard, they might snap off, causing you to have to glue them. Also, the propellers are so cheap that they chip, bend, and warp easily. And the worst part is that nobody stocks them! And if they do, they charge $10 a set!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: josh

customer_reviews.title: Great little machine!
customer_reviews.text: Very cool! I bought this because my son had bought me one for a present, and I took it outside and gave it the gas, and it flew up over the roof, and I haven't been able to find it to this day. So I bought this one to replace it, and never told my son. Really cool little machine. Amazing technology in such a small package.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent high-quality low cost quadcopter
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent high-quality low cost quadcopter. It's primary use is indoors but you can take a chance on flying outside if there is no wind. It is and excellent choice to gain practice on how to fly quadcopters. The controls are sensitive but very manageable. Moreover the copter is durable.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. T

customer_reviews.title: Erratic
customer_reviews.text: I have two lower tech RC helicopters which I use with no problem. This little thing-a-ma-bob is erratic, difficult to control and flimsy. It appears to have fine technology but it is not durable or reliable. I would recommend against buying this item unless you are determined and highly skilled in operating a mechanical house fly.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas L. Divita

customer_reviews.title: Best 1st quad for beginners.
customer_reviews.text: Have bought around 8 of them. For what they are they are great. If you can fly this you can fly a bigger quad. Anyone that ask me about getting into quads I tell them to get one of these first, because if you brake it no great loss.
customer_reviews.author: Citizen not Subject

customer_reviews.title: You need one of these.
customer_reviews.text: I order one of these micro quads and I have to say they are the funniest indoor toy you could have. Hours of entertainment. The one I received had a motor go out after 2 days, which was disappointing. I contacted the manufacture and they sent me out a brand new replacement. This company knows how to do business and the product is surprisingly durable.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin Cartwright

customer_reviews.title: I wouldn't recommend getting this for the price.
customer_reviews.text: This is a cool little toy. However, after about a week it just kind of stopped working. It'll turn on and sync with the remote, then once you take off it drops straight back down. I would recommend spending $10 more and getting a slightly larger quad that's more durable and lasts longer.
customer_reviews.author: thamitch

customer_reviews.title: My nephew was very excited by this, a present ...
customer_reviews.text: My nephew was very excited by this, a present for his 11th birthday. He was able to assemble the toy quickly by himself. Many thanks to the reviewers who suggested buying additional blades, as they were needed immediately before my nephew became less spastic with the remote.
customer_reviews.author: NYC Nurse

customer_reviews.title: Propellers fly off each time it falls inside.
customer_reviews.text: The propellers just sort of fly off. Is the idea for people to lose them immediately so we immediately have to buy more? That's not cool at all. And also, mine after only a few flights has a motor that spins without any throttle (it's the only one that does this). It has lots of potential but needs work.
customer_reviews.author: John. A

customer_reviews.title: awesome
customer_reviews.text: love this thing for indoor flying. somthing to get me through the winter untill i can get my big quad outdoors again. battery life is short but other than that it is very fun, a little hard to get used to flying it at first it is very touchy. but once you practice i have a very good control of it now. is actually very stable. controller is small but it's ok.
customer_reviews.author: N. Bush

customer_reviews.title: Fun!
customer_reviews.text: My 12 year old son has had this for a few months and loves it. We have had a ton of copters over the years and this one has held up pretty well. The blades pop off and break occasionally, but it is inexpensive to have more on hand. Plus, it comes with a few extra. My 10 year old liked his brother's so much he just ordered his own.
customer_reviews.author: Roger

customer_reviews.title: fun but fragile, beware.
customer_reviews.text: Fun toy but the mounts for the motors are plastic tabs that are very flimsy. The tabs snapped on one motor making the nano very difficult to fly, and I can't replace that part. It's grounded after only a handfull of flights. I am a novice with these things but I wasn't crashing it into everything.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fun little thing!
customer_reviews.text: This ultra micro quad is really fun! It is surprisingly stable and maneuverable for such a tiny little thing. It is fast too. You'll need a light touch on the sticks since they're so short. I love the LED lights. They really help keep orientation of the quad. The props sometimes pop off during a crash, but if you can find them again, they pop right back on w/o any problems.
customer_reviews.author: Impostor71

customer_reviews.title: Hard to fly
customer_reviews.text: This device is a lot harder to fly than others I have had. It also looses the blades almost every time it crashes. So if you fly it outside, that means you cant find them and you are quickly into a situation where you need to buy more and can't use it till you get them. I would look at another option especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Applegate

customer_reviews.title: Purchased for my nephews birthday and it arrived shattered in ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my nephews birthday and it arrived shattered in the box. This is more of a negative review of the shipper/delivery guy and maybe not so much the product itself.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Fun & Affordable
customer_reviews.text: First quadcopter I have owned. I took me a few sessions to get the handle on the controls. It's fun to fly and there's even a built-in function to do mid-air flips...!
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Great little flyer
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this to see how it would fly. Wasn't expecting much, but was thoroughly impressed with its maneuverability, It performs flips and is very stable. I also have the Hubsan 107L and found the transmitter for that works on the Estes Proto X. The small transmitter it comes wiht is a bit hard for adults to use. All in all a great little quad.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Great drone and flys amazingly well
customer_reviews.text: A very fun little toy. Flies great and steady and charges quickly. This was bought as a foray into drones and it has not disappointed. We fly it around our office a lot and except for the occasional issues with blades flying off it has been flawless. My daughter loves it as well.
customer_reviews.author: kmurphy

customer_reviews.title: This thing is a riot
customer_reviews.text: I never write reviews. I was compelled to write a review for this little drone. Someone in my office brought one of these in about two weeks ago. Now about 5 of us have them. It will never be the same again. Easy to fly, no real risk of damage to life or property, sturdy and resilient make this thing a winner. It landed in the dog water bowl after a particularly nasty crash. I shook the water off of it vigorously, let it dry a couple of hours and it was good to go. I wouldn't recommend getting it wet but it survived. Even if you aren't a R/C airplane geek I think you will enjoy this little toy.
customer_reviews.author: James W. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Great little quad (sort of...)
customer_reviews.text: Nice small quad, one flaw is that if you bang it up a bit it flies really weird. When it happens, you can only fly it with tons of trim and it drifts around etc. Replaced motor, maybe worked for a bit (cant remember exactly) still had problem. I called Estes Customer support and after like 5 minutes they shipped me a new one for free. Same problem happened eventually with second Proto X. IF ANYONE HAS ADVICE ON GETTING IT WORKING AGAIN PLEASE COMMENT! Pros: fast, agile, fun, cheap, can fly in very small spaces, etc. Cons: it breaks and after that you don't want to fly it much because it handles so weirdly.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas P. Kehler

customer_reviews.title: The tiny copter provides hours of fun, but it is a good thing that it ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought these tiny drones for the males on my gift list last Christmas. It was a howling success! The tiny copter provides hours of fun, but it is a good thing that it comes with spare propellers as it takes time to get used to using the controls and involved numerous crashes.
customer_reviews.author: Happy House Frau

customer_reviews.title: Great Product, Bad Battery
customer_reviews.text: Great product, poor battery life. I've only been using it for the last month or so and the battery life is pretty bad on it. I used to be able to run it for 8-10 minutes, now it has dropped down to 5 or so minutes. I wish the battery life wasn't so bad.
customer_reviews.author: Alvin

customer_reviews.title: Fun!
customer_reviews.text: These are a lot of fun and fly nicely. The copters come with an extra set of blades that you will wind up needing if you crash. I have run into walls, lamps and furniture and have broken 2 blades after flying them about 20 times. My 6 & 7 year olds are having a great time learning how to fly them.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: I love this Nano
customer_reviews.text: I love this Nano, it is very easy to fly, great for indoor use and is tough! I have been looking for a small quad for indoor flying for those rainy and windy days when outdoor flying was just out of the question. Well I am happy to say, I found it in the Estes 4606 Proto X Nano, it is perfect for small areas and easy to learn for the beginner or for the experienced pilot as well. I recommend this little quad copter for anyone who wants to have fun flying indoors, I've flown it outdoors on calm days as well, lots of fun.
customer_reviews.author: hollis jamar

customer_reviews.title: At first it seems super durable, but after a week of crashes the ...
customer_reviews.text: At first it seems super durable, but after a week of crashes the motor mounts don't hold well, and the whole thing drifts way too much. I bought replacement motor mounts but to put them in you have to de solder the motors from the body, and those wires are TINY!
customer_reviews.author: Glen C. Mcknight

customer_reviews.title: fun
customer_reviews.text: I am no where near as accomplished at this as my grandson, but with practice I can go in and out of the microwave door without disastrous consequences. My grandson can do amazing things with this machine. I do not consider this a toy. It is an R/C flying craft requiring skill and practice!
customer_reviews.author: grody

customer_reviews.title: fun little  toy
customer_reviews.text: it does what it's supposed to be pretty darn well, just wish they could get the things to hold altitude a little more evenly. Also they don't seem to mention that the props are color coded for front and back and that you have to look at the pitch angle to get the one you need to replace correct.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hammonds

customer_reviews.title: Motors burn out quickly. Fun to fly.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered in March 2014. Motors burn out quickly. Had it for a two days before back left motor went out. Estes (manufacturer) has had so many orders for the replacement motors that they are sold out. All the websites I found had backorder dates of mid April 14. Motors have to be soldered into place. - Fun. Cheap. Wish it worked longer than two days.
customer_reviews.author: J. Stapp

customer_reviews.title: Great little quad
customer_reviews.text: Great little quad. Amazingly small. It is literally the length and width of the height of a nine volt battery. A tip for those having trouble getting it stable to calibrate it put it on a completely level surface then move the throttle to the bottom right and start throttling up while holding the yaw completely right. When the props start to spin back off til they srop then flick the right stick left and right until the blue lights dlicker and it is then calibrated to its center of gravity No wrestling with the trim. Love it. Keep flying!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Hubbisse

customer_reviews.title: Fun, but fragile
customer_reviews.text: It was great while it lasted! This was my very first drone purchase so I wanted something inexpensive that I could use to learn the basics. For that purpose it was perfect. However, the rotors were very easily damaged or lost, and after a couple of weeks of use it was out of commission. I only flew it indoors and was careful not to have any serious crashes, but I guess after enough novice landings it decided it couldn't take anymore. Wish it would have lasted a bit longer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Too Much Fun
customer_reviews.text: This is a very sensitive and responsive toy. The more I play with it the more I develop a 'touch' for operating it. I have a couple of R/C copters that seem like flying turtles in comparison, this is fast. My daughters cats can't hide fast enough when they hear it.
customer_reviews.author: Xcaliber

customer_reviews.title: Proto This!
customer_reviews.text: One of the most fun little hobby items I think I've ever owned. Sure, the Proto X is not designed to be highly customizable 3D copter, but for on the go fun with incredible control, it's a great addition to any hobbyists arsenal, or even as your first introduction to micro flight.
customer_reviews.author: CLop

customer_reviews.title: consider the Blade to be the better buy.
customer_reviews.text: Cute little thing. Seems well made. But keeps losing props. Reasonably stable, but not as much as the Blade Nano with its SAFE technology. Additionally, the Blade is quite a bit more capable of taking a beating. I have both, consider the Blade to be the better buy.
customer_reviews.author: Homac

customer_reviews.title: Fun but it didn't last
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my nephew who is 13 & has many remote toys. He loved playing with it but after a day of play it did not work any more. I think it came with 1 or 2 extra propellers but they break easily after crashing several times.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth L. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Fun.  Stable. Durable.
customer_reviews.text: I've broken several different types of RC helicopters. Either due to my own poor skill (flying into wall), the copter's instability (more crashing into wall), or the copter's fragility (more walls). This one has survived my tests flights (into walls). It actually is highly stable in flight and very responsive. It comes with a second set of rotor blades in case.... you know... a wall. I haven't had to use them yet. Very fun toy.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Barrett

customer_reviews.title: Lots of fun - cheap parts!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a lot of fun, very stable out of the box . If you're not keen on the larger hubsan x4 which is essentially the same thing but larger, then this might be for you if you take into consideration: A scraped a nicked rotor blade will compromise stability, and flight time. Buy extra rotor blades! The electric motors (especially blue and red wired ones) are very prone to fail because they're not designed for this type of extreme throttling. You will need extra motors, and a steady hand for soldering the motors on/off.
customer_reviews.author: kbad

customer_reviews.title: Super fun. Super small. Great price and great way to get into quads.
customer_reviews.text: Amazingly small. Flies amazingly well. Can be used inside but takes some skill. Can be used outside, but only on perfectly calm days. It's more rugged than I expected. It's also really hard to make it hover perfectly still...actually, it's impossible to do that.
customer_reviews.author: Matt @ LookIntoHawaiiDotCom

customer_reviews.title: She Flys!
customer_reviews.text: Few beers and fun colored fruit based goods, trying to dogfight a few of thess minx's ended in a frothy golden splash down. Max points in style of course, but she never powered into the sky again.... 24h later.... SHE LIVES!!!# EPIC.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Highly stable, super tiny, agile quad
customer_reviews.text: A great indoor novelty toy. Emphasis on indoor. It's best to fly this indoors over soft carpet until you trim it well and learn the thrust curve. Looking at the construction, I can see that the circuit board is part of the structure. If you hit anything and crack a trace or knock a component off, you'll probably need to buy a new one. While it's transmitter is also tiny, it is not difficult to adapt to and is precise enough for the job (I have large hands).
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth A Kriegel

product_meta.title: Estes 4606 Proto X Nano R/C Quadcopter (Colors Vary) (Discontinued by manufacturer)
product_meta.description:
FROM THE MANUFACTURER
This is the Electric Powered, 2.4GHz Radio Controlled, Ready to Fly Proto X Nano Quadcopter from Estes. For Ages 14 and Above. For Indoor Use Only.
feature_bullets: FEATURES: Plastic body with window and trim detail LED light indicates front and back of the heli and also helps in low light flying 4-channel 2.4GHz
INCLUDES: RTF Proto X Nano Quadcopter, 2.4GHz Radio, LiPo Battery, USB Charge Cord, 4 spare rotor blades and Instructions
REQUIRES: AAA Batteries: Two for transmitter

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.6 out of 5 stars990 ratings3.6 out of 5 stars
